markdownRemark.html:
Servant-leadership as a term was originally coined by Robert K. Greenleaf in the 1970s. Wikipedia defines Mr. Greenleaf's philosophy and approach to leadership as being different from traditional leadership:

This is different from traditional leadership where the leader's main focus is the thriving of their company or organizations. A Servant Leader shares power, puts the needs of the employees first and helps people develop and perform as highly as possible[1]. Servant leadership inverts the norm, which puts the customer service associates as a main priority. Instead of the people working to serve the leader, the leader exists to serve the people[2].
